attributes.action: Prevent police officers under investigation for misconduct/criminal offences from resigning/retiring "on health grounds" until after investigation/court case completed
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Police officers are "allowed" to retire/resign, especially "on poor health issues" while under investigation on disciplinary/criminal matters.

This loophole is being exploited by some officers who would otherwise be found guilty and be dismissed. As a result, dishonest officers may then go on to other jobs,which they would not have got, had this loophole been closed earlier. They also get to keep their police pensions.

This must end, in the interests of transparency, there should be a blanket ban on such practice taking place.

Any officer wishing to retire/resign on health grounds should be paid S.S.P. until the conclusion of the hearing/trial verdict.
